overview: This 2-year, 4-semester MSEAI path emphasizes deep learning, NLP, and practical ML engineering skills for production systems. It balances theory with hands-on implementation.

courses.name: Introduction to Deep Learning
courses.rationale: Core course for MSEAI. Hands-on experience with neural networks, CNNs, and RNNs using PyTorch.

courses.name: Machine Learning
courses.rationale: Foundational ML course covering supervised and unsupervised learning, essential for all AI work.

courses.name: Foundations of Computational Data Science
courses.rationale: Data processing and analysis fundamentals. Critical for working with real-world ML datasets.

courses.name: Natural Language Processing
courses.rationale: Specialized in NLP for my career path. Covered transformers, BERT, and GPT architectures.

courses.name: Machine Learning with Large Datasets
courses.rationale: Learning to scale ML to production-sized datasets. Essential for industry work at Google.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Vision
courses.rationale: Broadened my AI knowledge. Useful for multi-modal ML systems.

courses.name: Advanced Multimodal Machine Learning
courses.rationale: Cutting-edge research course. Worked on vision-language models, relevant for modern AI systems.

courses.name: Machine Learning in Production
courses.rationale: Learned MLOps, model deployment, and monitoring. Critical for ML engineering roles.

courses.name: Search Engines
courses.rationale: Directly relevant to my Google role. Information retrieval and ranking algorithms.

courses.name: Master's Thesis Research
courses.rationale: Completed thesis on transformer architectures for low-resource languages. Published at ACL conference.

courses.name: API Design and Implementation
courses.rationale: Practical software engineering for ML systems. Helped me build production-ready ML APIs.

overview: This 2-year, 4-semester MSIT path focuses on software architecture, distributed systems, and cloud computing. Perfect for building scalable enterprise systems.

courses.name: Introduction to Deep Learning
courses.rationale: Hands-on deep learning with PyTorch. Built CNNs, RNNs, and transformers. Most practical course.

courses.name: Natural Language Processing
courses.rationale: My specialty area. Learned text processing, language models, and NLP applications.

courses.name: Distributed Systems
courses.rationale: Understanding distributed computing is important for training large models at scale.

courses.name: Natural Language Processing (Advanced)
courses.rationale: Deep dive into transformer architectures and modern NLP. Final project became my thesis.

courses.name: Machine Learning (PhD Level)
courses.rationale: Advanced ML theory. Challenging but gave me deeper understanding of learning algorithms.

courses.name: Computer Graphics
courses.rationale: Elective for fun. Interesting to see visual applications of linear algebra.

courses.name: Multimodal Machine Learning
courses.rationale: Cutting-edge research area. Learned to work with vision + language models.

courses.name: Parallel Computer Architecture and Programming
courses.rationale: GPU programming and parallel algorithms - essential for training neural networks efficiently.

courses.name: Special Topics: ML Ethics
courses.rationale: Important to understand societal impact of AI systems.

courses.name: Capstone Project
courses.rationale: Built an NLP application for low-resource African languages. Great portfolio piece.

courses.name: Database Systems
courses.rationale: Understanding data storage and retrieval is crucial for ML engineering roles.

courses.name: Nature of Language
courses.rationale: Linguistics perspective on language. Helped me understand NLP from a different angle.

overview: This pathway focuses on building scalable, reliable systems. Heavy emphasis on systems programming, distributed computing, and cloud technologies.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Programming
courses.rationale: Started with Python. Good foundation for software engineering principles.

courses.name: Concepts of Mathematics
courses.rationale: Mathematical foundations for CS. Proof techniques are useful for correctness arguments.

courses.name: Interpretation and Argument
courses.rationale: Gen ed. Improved technical writing skills.

courses.name: Principles of Imperative Computation
courses.rationale: Learned C and low-level programming. Essential for systems work.

courses.name: Principles of Functional Programming
courses.rationale: Functional paradigm changed how I think about code. Useful for writing clean, testable code.

courses.name: Matrices and Linear Transformations
courses.rationale: Math requirement. Linear algebra shows up in computer graphics and optimization.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Systems
courses.rationale: THE most important course for systems engineering. Memory, processes, networks - everything.

courses.name: Great Ideas in Theoretical Computer Science
courses.rationale: Algorithm analysis and complexity theory. Important for making design decisions.

courses.name: Introduction to Probability Theory
courses.rationale: Probability is key for understanding distributed systems behavior and failure modes.

courses.name: Operating System Design and Implementation
courses.rationale: Built an OS kernel. Extremely challenging but incredibly rewarding. Best course I took.

courses.name: Compiler Design
courses.rationale: Understanding compilers deepened my knowledge of programming languages and optimization.

courses.name: Distributed Systems
courses.rationale: Core course for my career. Learned about consensus, replication, consistency models.

courses.name: Computer Networks
courses.rationale: Understanding networks is crucial for distributed systems. Protocols, TCP/IP, routing.

courses.name: Database Systems
courses.rationale: Databases are the backbone of most systems. Learned about transactions, indexing, query optimization.

courses.name: Distributed Systems (Graduate)
courses.rationale: Advanced topics in distributed systems. Research papers on Paxos, Raft, distributed transactions.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Computer Networks
courses.rationale: Graduate-level networking. Deep dive into network protocols and performance.

courses.name: Special Topics: Cloud Computing
courses.rationale: Hands-on with AWS, Azure, Kubernetes. Directly applicable to industry work.

courses.name: Parallel Computer Architecture and Programming
courses.rationale: Parallel programming, GPU computing, performance optimization. Critical for scalable systems.

courses.name: Advanced Cloud Computing
courses.rationale: Research-level cloud computing. Studied large-scale system design patterns.

courses.name: Foundations of Software Engineering
courses.rationale: Software development processes, testing, CI/CD. Important professional skills.

courses.name: Capstone: Scalable Microservices Platform
courses.rationale: Built a complete microservices platform with service mesh, monitoring, auto-scaling.

courses.name: Machine Learning Systems
courses.rationale: How to build infrastructure for ML workloads. Interesting intersection of my interests.

courses.name: Projects in Economics and Data Science
courses.rationale: Understanding business context helps in system design decisions.

overview: A balanced path combining technical CS skills with business, design, and communication. Prepared for transition from engineering to product management.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Programming
courses.rationale: Essential programming foundation. Python is great for quick prototyping.

courses.name: Concepts of Mathematics
courses.rationale: Math requirement. Logical thinking helps in product reasoning.

courses.name: Writing about Data
courses.rationale: Learning to communicate data insights clearly - crucial for PM work.

courses.name: Principles of Imperative Computation
courses.rationale: Core CS algorithms and data structures. Important to understand technical constraints.

courses.name: Designing Human-Centered Software
courses.rationale: Introduction to HCI. Learned user research methods and usability testing.

courses.name: Reasoning with Data
courses.rationale: Statistics for data-driven decision making. Essential PM skill.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Systems
courses.rationale: Systems fundamentals. Helps understand technical tradeoffs in product decisions.

courses.name: Principles of Software Construction
courses.rationale: Software design patterns, testing, APIs. Great for working with engineering teams.

courses.name: User-Centered Research and Evaluation
courses.rationale: Deep dive into user research. Learned to conduct interviews and analyze qualitative data.

courses.name: Great Ideas in Theoretical Computer Science
courses.rationale: Computational thinking and problem-solving frameworks.

courses.name: Programming Usable Interfaces
courses.rationale: Built several UIs. Understanding frontend development helps in product discussions.

courses.name: Principles of Microeconomics
courses.rationale: Business fundamentals. Understanding markets and incentives is key for product strategy.

courses.name: Database Applications
courses.rationale: Practical database work. Important for data-driven products.

courses.name: Special Topics: Product Management
courses.rationale: Guest lectures from PMs at tech companies. Learned product frameworks and methodologies.

courses.name: Marketing I
courses.rationale: Understanding marketing helps in go-to-market strategy and positioning.

courses.name: Introduction to Cryptography
courses.rationale: Security awareness is important for any product manager dealing with user data.

courses.name: Foundations of Software Engineering
courses.rationale: Agile, scrum, sprint planning. Direct overlap with PM responsibilities.

courses.name: Modern Regression
courses.rationale: Data analysis for A/B testing and experimentation.

courses.name: Special Topics: Startup Entrepreneurship
courses.rationale: Startup mindset, MVP development, pitching. Worked on a product idea with a team.

courses.name: Web Application Development
courses.rationale: Full-stack web dev. Can prototype product ideas independently.

courses.name: Science and Science Fiction
courses.rationale: Fun elective. Thinking about future technology trends.

courses.name: Capstone: Mobile App for Local Artisans
courses.rationale: Led a team to build a marketplace app. Acted as both PM and developer.

courses.name: Interaction Design Studio
courses.rationale: End-to-end design process. From user research to high-fidelity prototypes.

courses.name: Business Strategy
courses.rationale: Strategic thinking for competitive positioning and growth.
